REFERENDUM.Definition: a vote where all people in the country chose yes or no about an important question

SCANDAL.Definition: a bad event that made people angry or shocked

PEAK.Definition: the highest point or the most important time

UNION JACK.Definition: the national flag of the United Kingdom

SUBJECTS.Definition: people ruled by a king or queen

PREJUDICE.Definition: an unfair dislike of someone because of race, religion or other reasons

DISCRIMINATION.Definition: unfair treatment of people based on race, gender or something else

LANDLORDS.Definition: people who rented out buildings or accommodation

MIRAGE.Definition: something that seemed real, but was not

SECTORS.Definition: parts or areas of work or life

CHARITY.Definition: help given to people in need

PATRIOTIC.Definition: showing love for and being proud of their country

TURN THEM AWAY.Definition: refuse to allow them to stay, send them away

STRUGGLE.Definition: a hard time or fight to do it

CULMINATED.Definition: reached the point of highest development

SETTLED.Definition: made a home in the new place

CLAMP DOWN ON.Definition: take strong action to stop them

DEPORTED.Definition: sent back to their own country by the government

TENANTS.Definition: people who rented a house or flat to live in

VERIFY.Definition: check if things were true or right

CUT OFF FROM.Definition: no longer able to get or use them

FORMALITY.Definition: a rule or thing they had to do to make their status official

DIGITALISATION.Definition: changes in the system or processes to be operated with the use of computers and the internet

UNWITTING.Definition: not knowing that it was happening

EVICTED.Definition: made to leave their home by law

DEPORTATION.Definition: the act of sending them back to their own country

DETAINED.Definition: kept there and not allowed to leave

MISTREATED.Definition: treated in a cruel or unfair way

PROOF.Definition: something that showed their claims were true

FALLOUT.Definition: the bad results of the situation

COMPENSATION.Definition: money given to people who were treated unfairly

COMPENSATE.Definition: pay or give something because of loss or hurt

ENTITLED.Definition: having the right to get it

BUREAUCRATIC.Definition: relating to a system of government that had too many rules or steps

WRONGS.Definition: things that were unfair or not right

PARTIALLY.Definition: not completely, only in a way
